OUR STORY

Why We Exist

Peace and Humanitarian Initiative Trust (PHI) was founded by BASTER WILLIE MAGWIZI and TIMOTHY SITHOLE out of a deep-seated commitment to address the systemic challenges facing vulnerable communities in Zimbabwe. Having witnessed firsthand the devastating cycle of conflict, poverty, and climate disasters, they established PHI as a non-governmental organization dedicated to creating lasting, community-driven solutions. Our foundation is not just a mission statement; it's a promise to foster a world where peace, dignity, and justice are upheld for all.

OUR LEADERSHIP

Meet Our Founders

BASTER WILLIE MAGWIZI

Co-Founder

BASTER WILLIE MAGWIZI brings extensive experience in humanitarian work and community development. His dedication to social justice and grassroots empowerment has been the driving force behind PHI's community-centered approach. He envisions an organization that amplifies local voices and builds sustainable peace from the ground up.

TIMOTHY SITHOLE

Co-Founder

TIMOTHY SITHOLE is a seasoned advocate for human rights and peacebuilding. With a background in conflict resolution and humanitarian assistance, he has dedicated his career to protecting the most vulnerable. His vision for PHI is to create transformative change through strategic partnerships and evidence-based interventions.

OUR GUIDING PRINCIPLES

Our Vision and Mission

Our Vision

"To foster a world where peace, dignity, human rights and social justice are upheld for all global citizens regardless of race, gender, nationality, or socioeconomic status."

Our Mission

"To promote sustainable peace, advance human rights, and deliver life-saving humanitarian aid to vulnerable communities across the globe. We work to empower individuals and strengthen institutions through advocacy, education, and direct action."

OUR CORE VALUES

The Values That Guide Us

In carrying out our mandate, every decision we make is guided by a commitment to the following principles:

Honesty - We operate with truthfulness and sincerity
Integrity - We adhere to the highest moral and ethical principles
Accountability - We take responsibility for our actions and their outcomes
Fairness - We ensure impartial and just treatment for all individuals
Justice - We are committed to upholding rights and ensuring equity
Transparency - We operate with openness to build trust with our partners
Ubuntu - We believe in shared humanity and interconnected communities

ORGANIZATIONAL STRUCTURE

Organized for Effective Action

PHI is a registered non-governmental organization (Registration number: MA0000063/2019) governed by a dedicated Board of Trustees that provides strategic oversight and ensures fiduciary accountability. Our operations are led by an Executive Director and implemented through a head office in Bulawayo and three regional offices in Harare (Northern), Mutare (Eastern), and Masvingo (Southern). This structure ensures we remain deeply connected and responsive to the unique needs of the communities we serve.

GOVERNANCE
